metadata.title: CVE-2017-14749 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-preview 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
JerryScript 1.0 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service(jmem_heap_alloc_block_internal heap memory corruption) or possibly executearbitrary code via a crafted .js file, because unrecognized \ characterscause incorrect 0x00 characters in bytecode.literal data.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-14749` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

iotjs - 1.0+715-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: iotjs package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.0+715-1ubuntu1').
